annotation: This problem requires finding the length of the space diagonal of a cylinder, which can be solved by applying the Pythagorean theorem to a right triangle formed by the cylinder's height and the diameter of its base.
problem_text_en: A soft drink can has a height of 13 cm and a radius of 3 cm. Find L, the length of the longest straw that can fit into the can (so that the straw is not bent and fits entirely inside the can). Give your answer rounded down to the nearest cm, to ensure it fits inside the can.
